page.title: 01THE SOUTH OF BREDON HILL
page.content: This block is on the southern slopes of{Bredon Hill.}It is a rural area of great natural beauty.Most of the land is farmed,although few people are now employed on the land.A mixture of crops is grown,including wheat,barley, potatoes,broad beans,oil seed rape, linseed etc.There is considerable deciduous tree cover,particularly on the upper slopes of the hill and some small coniferous plantations. There are also large areas of permanent pasture grazed by sheep, cattle and horses.The main villages within the area are{Overbury,Kemerton,Westmancote {and Bredon's Norton.}These villages contain numerous beautiful stone built houses. There are{Norman Churches at {Overbury and at Bredon's Norton,}where there is also a historic{Manor House. The area is criss- crossed with public footpaths and is popular with walkers.
